JobTitle: Ethics Analyst, Business Ethics & Resolve (Hybrid / Remote)
JobDescription:
Job Classification:
Corporate - Legal and Compliance
Prudential Financial, Inc. is a leading U.S. based publicly traded global life insurance and diversified financial services corporation with a world class brand and balance sheet. The company is committed to helping customers grow and protect their wealth through a variety of products and services including life insurance, annuities, investments and retirement-related services.


Our Role:

We are seeking an Analyst, Ethics for Prudential. This position sits within the Global Business Ethics & Integrity Global Program and reports directly to Prudential’s Corporate Ethics Officer. Given the person in this role will work cross-functionally across global businesses and corporate functions, strong communication and interpersonal skills are a must.


Responsibilities include:

• Primarily responsible for generating data for ethics reporting (CRCA, Board, BEO, IAC, etc.)

• Support drafting of reporting, data analytics, trend identification, root cause analysis, remediation, CRMP data, and related topics

• Assist the team in assessing and improving the efficiency of global conflicts and ethics processes and matters, including on matters related to policies, procedures, supporting technology, communications, and training

• Support core functions of Ethics Department, including Ethics Case Management, governance, and Business Ethics Officer Program

• Provide advice and guidance to employees with respect to conflict-of-interest policies and procedures related to conflict evaluations and management, as well as Code of Conduct, ethics policies and procedures related to ethics reporting

• Perform other related duties as assigned


Qualifications:

• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

• Ability to interact and communicate effectively with cross-functional partners

• Knowledge and expertise of laws, rules, regulations, risks and appropriate controls

• Demonstrated ability to assess complex issues through root cause analysis and other analytical techniques; structure potential solutions; drive to resolution with stakeholders

• Ability to influence and lead people across cultures at a senior level using sound judgment and successful execution, understanding how to operate effectively across diverse businesses

• Ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive matters and exercise discretion

• Excellent organizational skills and the ability to meet competing deadlines

• Ability to work effectively in matrixed organization and develop/maintain relationships with cross-functional partners

• Demonstrated ability to achieve results in a fast paced, deadline driven environment with multiple priorities and stakeholders

• Bachelor’s degree

• Financial services/insurance industry experience preferred; global ethics and compliance program experience required
#LI-REMOTE
Note: Prudential is required by state specific laws to include the salary range for this role when hiring a resident in applicable locations. The salary range for this role is from $83,300.00 to $124,000.00. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance. In addition, employees are eligible for standard benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental and retirement.
Prudential Financial, Inc. of the United States is not affiliated with Prudential plc. which is headquartered in the United Kingdom.
Prudential is a multinational financial services leader with operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Leveraging its heritage of life insurance and asset management expertise, Prudential is focused on helping individual and institutional customers grow and protect their wealth. The company's well-known Rock symbol is an icon of strength, stability, expertise and innovation that has stood the test of time. Prudential's businesses offer a variety of products and services, including life insurance, annuities, retirement-related services, mutual funds, asset management, and real estate services.
We recognize that our strength and success are directly linked to the quality and skills of our diverse associates. We are proud to be a place where talented people who want to make a difference can grow as professionals, leaders, and as individuals. Visit www.prudential.com to learn more about our values, our history and our brand.

Paramount Global (NASDAQ: PARA, PARAA) is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic studios, networks and streaming services, Paramount's portfolio of consumer brands includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, Paramount+, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. Paramount delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industry's most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products, the company provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions.

This Business Operations Analyst supports the Ad Operations team in crafting and maintaining the processes and systems that enable ad delivery across a multi-platform digital environment. Experience in Digital streaming
Experience integrating partners on desktop, mobile and connected device platforms

Business Analyst Certification and/or Project Management Certification

Clinical Business Analyst
 - (3223505)
About Us:
As a not-for-profit organization, Mass General Brigham is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Mass General Brigham supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.

We’re focused on a people-first culture for our system’s patients and our professional family. That’s why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Mass General Brigham is committed to aligning our employees’ personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal development—and we recognize success at every step.

Our employees use the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.
General Summary:
At Mass General Brigham Digital, we pride ourselves on our ability to create maximum strategic, clinical, and operational value from established and emergent technologies for our patients, care teams, researchers, and employees. Digital health will not only enhance the equity and efficiency of healthcare delivery, but it will also help make medicine more personalized and precise.
We recognize that increasing value and continually improving quality while maintaining an inclusive focus are essential to organizational excellence, and we invite you to join us on this journey. The work we do in Digital is a strategic imperative, and there is a strong and growing understanding of how together we will transform Mass General Brigham in innovative and impactful ways.
The Clinical Business Analyst I works with users to provide software support services. Work with users to understand clinical and business workflows, document functional requirements, execute test scripts and user acceptance testing.
Position Summary:
The Clinical Business Analyst is primarily focused on providing end user support of Epic clinical and complementary applications to clinical end users at Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Brigham and Women’s Faulkner Hospital.
Acting as the key liaison between the operational and clinical community and Enterprise teams, the Clinical Business Analyst will use their knowledge of application functionality, system processes and clinical workflows to provide exceptional customer service and day to day support. Support channels include but are not limited to, telephone, remote, classroom and in person support in patient care/clinical areas.
Under the direction of the Manager for Brigham Health Inpatient Clinical Systems Team, the individual in this role will:
Primarily function in a support-based role working with end-users through normal business hours, and will participate in an overnight, weekend and holiday on-call rotation.
Develop a solid understanding of how an application works, including day-to-day end-user support, workflow analysis and design.
Participate in change review and application testing for new releases for both Epic and non Epic applications supported by the Inpatient team. Creates and updates training and communication release materials as needed. Communicates application updates and changes to appropriate users.
Participate in on-site support weekly rotation at BWH/BWF main campuses and distributed offsite locations. Provides at the elbow support when needed and participates in an assigned facility rounding rotation.
Provide off hours (weekends and/or evenings) on-site support multiple times per year for Epic upgrades and other organizational project go-lives.
Build and maintain healthy working relationships with end users, leadership, and other team members and teams in the Digital department.
Works with senior staff and customers to elicit requirements, and document workflow changes and impacts, for Epic enhancement and demand requests.
Work with senior staff to plan task and project work. Complete work assignments in accordance with established timelines, raise issues to senior staff when appropriate
Identify system and related operational issues and participate in solution design with team domain experts.
Respond to all customer requests in a timely manner, recognizes degree of urgency and is able to prioritize independently, involves other staff as the need arises.
Communicate effectively, both written and verbally, with stakeholders, customers, and peers. Provides consistent, proactive, and timely follow-up and updates in accordance with applicable Standard Level Agreements and Targets (SLA, SLT).
Delegate tasks to other resources at the direction of the Manager and/or senior staff members.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Support and educate users on the use of clinical and complementary applications. Prepare end-user training materials.
Identify and resolve issues, escalating as needed for timely resolution.
Provide high quality service to users, according to defined service level agreements.
Create and run reports as needed using tools such as Epic Reporting Workbench.

As a not-for-profit organization, Mass General Brigham is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community. Business Planning Analyst
 - (3222083)
About Mass General Brigham:
As a not-for-profit organization, Mass General Brigham is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Mass General Brigham is a national leader in biomedical research and an integrated health system that includes academic medical centers, community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home based care, and insurance company. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School.

We’re focused on a people-first culture for our system’s patients and our professional family. Mass General Brigham is committed to aligning our employees’ professional development with projects that match their capabilities, creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team in their professional development—and we recognize success at every step.
Our employees use the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.
The Strategy, Planning and Intelligence Team
Strategy, Planning and Intelligence reports to the SVP of Strategy at Mass General Brigham. This highly visible enterprise function supports C-suite executives and leaders across the system with analysis and insights of market trends and opportunities, business planning for strategic initiatives, and system strategy formation and planning.
Key team capabilities include problem solving and creative thinking, data analysis, financial analysis and modeling, market assessments and competitive intelligence using primary and secondary research, and facilitation skills.
Role and Responsibilities:
We are looking for a Business Planning Analyst to join the Mass General Brigham Strategy, Planning and Intelligence team. This individual will work as part of an experienced team of strategy, business planning, market research and foresight intelligence professionals to support the identification and creation of new business and revenue growth opportunities. This is a highly visible position that will provide insight and support to executive leadership on enterprise-wide level.
A Day in the Life:
Conduct opportunity sizing assessments for new businesses
Develop business plans for identified opportunities and initiatives including financial projections and return on investment

Practice Financial Reporting and Analysis: Conduct analysis of MGBCP practices for monthly financial reporting, budgeting, and forecasting. Perform additional analytics related to volume and revenue cycles, service line profitability, physician compensation and production. Clinician Compensation Reporting: Develop, maintain, and distribute Physician and Advanced Practice Clinician compensation reports. Practice Acquisition Analysis: Support the business plan development and analysis of physicians or groups being considered for employment by MGBCP, including practice benchmarking, pro forma development, capital planning, clinician compensation modeling, market analysis, and overall business plan/case development. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to explain analysis and findings to staff and management. Must be detail-oriented, reliable, and self-motivated.

CompanyName: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts
JobDescription:
Ready to help us transform healthcare? Bring your true colors to blue.

Reporting to the Associate Director of Finance Systems, the Business Analyst will support Finance initiatives to ensure project timelines, performance goals and standards are met and expected business value is realized. Working collaboratively with internal and external organizations, the Business Analyst will provide IT focused business analytical and system implementation support. In addition, the Business Analyst will also provides some project management and production resolution support of key financial systems.

Key Responsibilities:
Collaborates with business partners to ensure current state business process and future state business requirements are fully developed and documented.

Develop a strong understanding of the business and technical aspects of financial applications.
Analyzes and troubleshoots production/system issues, identifies root causes and develops recommendations for improvement.
Ability to identify upstream and downstream impacts that system enhancements may have on system processing and business.

Qualifications:
Excellent written/verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrates ability to follow through on multiple or complex tasks and issues.
Takes immediate action when confronted with a problem or when made aware of a situation.
Demonstrates advanced analysis and problem solving abilities.
Partners with other areas of the company to execute and implement divisional projects and strategies.
Excellent skills in working with cross-functional teams and resolving cross-departmental issues.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.

BA or BS degree in Systems, IT, Business Management, or related degree preferred; or equivalent experience.
